poem:
### Struck in Ras al-Nabaa

In Beirut's heart  
where voices gather,  
metal sings—a harsh note  
piercing silence.  
  
Name etched in echoes,  
Mohammed Afif now  
speaks only in absence,  
the dust swirls  
around empty shoes.  
  
Words become stones,  
unseen ripples  
spread from  
an unmarked center,  
in a city holding its breath.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Israeli strike on Beirut kills Hezbollah media chief Mohammed Afif Hezbollah’s chief spokesman has been killed by an Israeli airstrike on Beirut, as Israel intensifies its air offensive in Lebanon despite ongoing indirect negotiations for a ceasefire. Mohammed Afif, who has been the public face of Hezbollah for months, was killed in a strike on offices of the Ba’ath party in Ras al-Nabaa, central Beirut. The attack in the busy residential area came without warning,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
